conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sono felice
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am happy

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu sei bravo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are good

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui è italiano
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He is Italian

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi siamo amici
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We are friends

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi siete studenti
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are students

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro sono qui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They are here

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io ero stanco
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was tired

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu eri giovane
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were young

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lei era bella
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She was beautiful

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi eravamo contenti
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We were happy

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi eravate qui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were here

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro erano amici
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were friends

tenses.description: Used to describe ongoing, repeated, or habitual actions in the past. Also used for descriptions, states of being, and background information in storytelling.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sarò a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will be at home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu sarai bravo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will be good

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lei sarà felice
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She will be happy

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi saremo qui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will be here

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi sarete pronti
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will be ready

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro saranno amici
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will be friends

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'domani' (tomorrow) or 'la prossima settimana' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sono stato a Roma
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have been to Rome

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu sei stato bravo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have been good

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lei è stata gentile
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She has been kind

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi siamo stati felici
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We have been happy

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi siete stati qui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have been here

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro sono stati amici
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They have been friends

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io fui molto sorpreso quando ricevetti la notizia
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was very surprised when I received the news

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu fosti il primo ad arrivare alla riunione importante
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were the first to arrive at the important meeting

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lei fu una grande scienziata per tutta la sua vita
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She was a great scientist throughout her life

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi fummo testimoni di un evento straordinario
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We were witnesses to an extraordinary event

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi foste molto coraggiosi durante quella difficile situazione
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were very brave during that difficult situation

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro furono i migliori amici fino alla fine
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were the best friends until the end

tenses.description: Used to describe completed actions in the distant past with no connection to the present. More common in Southern Italy and in formal writing, literature, and historical narratives.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io ero stato malato prima di partire per il viaggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had been sick before leaving for the trip

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu eri stato molto nervoso prima dell'esame finale
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been very nervous before the final exam

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lei era stata insegnante per vent'anni prima di andare in pensione
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had been a teacher for twenty years before retiring

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi eravamo stati al museo prima di andare al ristorante
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had been to the museum before going to the restaurant

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi eravate stati avvisati del pericolo che ci aspettava
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been warned about the danger that awaited us

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro erano stati buoni amici fino a quella lite
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had been good friends until that argument

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Essential for establishing the sequence of past events, often used with 'prima' or 'dopo'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sarò stato dappertutto nel mondo quando avrò cinquant'anni
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have been everywhere in the world when I'm fifty

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu sarai certamente stato stanco dopo questo lungo viaggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will certainly have been tired after this long journey

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lei sarà stata sposata per vent'anni l'anno prossimo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She will have been married for twenty years next year

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi saremo stati là prima che tu arrivi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will have been there before you arrive

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi sarete stati avvisati delle conseguenze prima di prendere la decisione
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have been warned of the consequences before making the decision

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro saranno stati in riunione tutto il giorno quando arriveremo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have been in a meeting all day when we arrive

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed before another future action or before a specific time in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'quando' or 'dopo che'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sarei felice
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would be happy

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu saresti bravo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would be good

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lei sarebbe gentile
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She would be kind

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi saremmo qui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We would be here

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi sareste pronti
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would be ready

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro sarebbero amici
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They would be friends

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'se' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sarei stato più felice se tu fossi venuto con me
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would have been happier if you had come with me

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu saresti stato orgoglioso di vedere il suo successo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have been proud to see his success

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lei sarebbe stata un'eccellente direttrice se avesse accettato il posto
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She would have been an excellent director if she had accepted the position

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi saremmo stati là prima se il treno non avesse avuto ritardo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We would have been there earlier if the train hadn't been delayed

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi sareste stati sorpresi di vedere i cambiamenti
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have been surprised to see the changes

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro sarebbero stati migliori amici se si fossero capiti meglio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They would have been better friends if they had understood each other better

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical past actions or regrets about things that didn't happen. Often used to describe what would have happened under different circumstances.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Spero che io sia felice
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hope that I am happy

conjugations.exampleSentence: Spero che tu sia bravo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hope that you are good

conjugations.exampleSentence: Spero che lei sia gentile
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hope that she is kind

conjugations.exampleSentence: Spero che noi siamo qui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hope that we are here

conjugations.exampleSentence: Spero che voi siate pronti
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hope that you are ready

conjugations.exampleSentence: Spero che loro siano amici
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hope that they are friends

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after certain expressions of opinion, doubt, emotion, or necessity. Common triggers include 'spero che' (I hope that) and 'è importante che' (it's important that).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sii bravo!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be good!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Siamo felici!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's be happy!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Siate gentili!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be kind!

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (tu, voi) and first person plural (noi). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Pensavo che io fossi troppo giovane per capire
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I thought that I was too young to understand

conjugations.exampleSentence: Speravo che tu fossi d'accordo con me
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hoped that you agreed with me

conjugations.exampleSentence: Credevo che lei fosse italiana
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I believed that she was Italian

conjugations.exampleSentence: Volevano che noi fossimo più puntuali
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They wanted us to be more punctual

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dubitavo che voi foste pronti per l'esame
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I doubted that you were ready for the exam

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sembrava che loro fossero molto stanchi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It seemed that they were very tired

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after expressions of doubt, emotion, or necessity when the main clause is in a past tense. Essential for expressing hypothetical situations in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Penso che io sia stato fortunato nella vita
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I think that I was lucky in life

conjugations.exampleSentence: È possibile che tu sia stato malinteso
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It's possible that you were misunderstood

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dubito che lei sia stata completamente onesta
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I doubt that she was completely honest

conjugations.exampleSentence: Temo che noi siamo stati troppo severi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I fear that we were too harsh

conjugations.exampleSentence: Mi dispiace che voi siate stati delusi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'm sorry that you were disappointed

conjugations.exampleSentence: Spero che loro siano stati felici insieme
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hope that they were happy together

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after expressions of doubt, emotion, or necessity when referring to a completed action in the past. Formed with the present subjunctive of the auxiliary verb plus the past participle.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Se io fossi stato più attento, avrei evitato l'errore
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If I had been more careful, I would have avoided the mistake

conjugations.exampleSentence: Pensavo che tu fossi stato informato della situazione
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I thought that you had been informed of the situation

conjugations.exampleSentence: Credevo che lei fosse stata all'estero per anni
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I believed that she had been abroad for years

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sarebbe stato meglio se noi fossimo stati più preparati
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It would have been better if we had been more prepared

conjugations.exampleSentence: Speravo che voi foste stati avvisati in tempo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I hoped that you had been warned in time

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dubitavo che loro fossero stati così ingenui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I doubted that they had been so naive

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses to express an action that occurred before another past action, often in hypothetical or contrary-to-fact statements. Formed with the imperfect subjunctive of the auxiliary verb plus the past participle.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dopo che io fui stato avvisato, partii immediatamente
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After I had been warned, I left immediately

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena tu fosti stato presentato, la cerimonia iniziò
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had been introduced, the ceremony began

conjugations.exampleSentence: Quando lei fu stata eletta, pronunciò un discorso memorabile
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When she had been elected, she gave a memorable speech

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dopo che noi fummo stati accolti, ci sedettimo a tavola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After we had been welcomed, we sat at the table

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena voi foste stati informati, prendeste la decisione
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had been informed, you made the decision

conjugations.exampleSentence: Quando loro furono stati riuniti, il re parlò
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When they had been gathered, the king spoke

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary Italian to express an action completed immediately before another past action in the remote past. Typically follows time expressions like 'dopo che', 'quando', 'appena'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: È importante essere onesti
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It's important to be honest

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voglio essere un buon padre
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want to be a good father

conjugations.exampleSentence: Prima di essere dottore, studiava medicina
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Before being a doctor, he studied medicine

tenses.description: The base form of the verb, used after auxiliary verbs, prepositions, and in many other constructions. The infinitive form of 'essere' is used to express existence, identity, or state of being.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dopo essere stato in Italia, parla meglio l'italiano
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After having been in Italy, he speaks Italian better

conjugations.exampleSentence: Senza essere stata preparata, affrontò la sfida
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Without having been prepared, she faced the challenge

conjugations.exampleSentence: Oltre ad essere stati avvisati, ci hanno anche aiutato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Besides having been warned, they also helped us

tenses.description: Used to express an action that occurred before the main action. Formed with the infinitive of 'essere' or 'avere' plus the past participle.
The verb 'essere' does not have a present participle form in Italian, as it is a state-of-being verb rather than an action verb.

conjugations.exampleSentence: È stato un giorno difficile
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It was a difficult day

conjugations.exampleSentence: È stata una festa meravigliosa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It was a wonderful party

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sono stati i primi ad arrivare
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were the first to arrive

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sono state molto gentili
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were very kind

tenses.description: Used to form compound tenses and as an adjective. The past participle of 'essere' agrees in gender and number with the subject.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo italiano, conosce bene la cucina del paese
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Being Italian, he knows the country's cuisine well

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo in ritardo, prese un taxi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Being late, he took a taxi

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo malata, non poté venire alla festa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Being sick, she couldn't come to the party

tenses.description: Used to express an action occurring simultaneously with the main action. Functions as an adverb and is invariable.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo stato in quella città, poté dare buoni consigli
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having been in that city, he could give good advice

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo stata avvisata, arrivò puntuale
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having been warned, she arrived on time

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo stati preparati, affrontarono l'esame con fiducia
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having been prepared, they faced the exam with confidence

tenses.description: Used to express an action that occurred before the main action. Formed with the gerund of 'essere' plus the past participle.
